1.title: Ding Dong Merrily on High
1.plot: Bell cancels Christmas at Elmsmere, upsetting everyone - including CJ, who buys a turkey for Christmas dinner. What he doesn't realise is that the turkey's alive, so he must hide it in Elmsmere. Bell is visited by a series of ghosts who want him to mend his ways.

2.title: Roof
2.plot: New boy Evan causes trouble for Polly, who's keeping an eye on him, by climbing onto the school roof. An old library book leads Darnesh to believe reality is collapsing, and CJ attempts to hide his lack of socks by painting his ankles.

3.title: Stig
3.plot: Owen discovers Fleur's new 'boyfriend' is actually Katie and to split them apart, convinced it's for Fleur's sake. Eleesha is left feeling abandoned, so she turns to Polly. Nunn and CJ battle over a pair of old pants.

4.title: Quitter
4.plot: CJ isn't happy when Bell hands in his letter of resignation to become a yellow coat at a holiday camp in Wales. Amber pretends she's a ghost to get free snacks from Darnesh, and Eli and Fleur must learn to tango.

5.title: Book Group
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Back to School
1.plot: Nathan Carter, once known as "Natty C", has left the rap business to become a teacher at his old school Elmsbury High where he was once a rebel student. However his arrival is made even more difficult because his younger brother Josh is going to the same school and is embarrassed at him turning his back on rap. In an effort to impress his sceptical head-teacher Mr. Byron, Nathan agrees to take charge of the "4 O'Clock Club" but is it really the group of highly motivated students eager for after-school activities that he thinks it is?

2.title: Assembly
2.plot: Josh tries to get Nathan off his back by tricking him into believing Miss Poppy is interested in him. Meanwhile Mr Byron is determined that the forthcoming assembly performance doesn't go badly wrong like so many others but Ryan's problems in remembering a simple line suggest things may not go well again.

3.title: Maths
3.plot: Josh hasn't done his Maths homework but senses a sneaky solution when he fools his Maths teacher into believing he has dyscalculia. Meanwhile Nathan is very worried about a forthcoming lesson observation with Mr Byron and Josh's deception may make it even more difficult for him.

4.title: Disco
4.plot: Nathan is unhappy when Mr Byron asks him to take charge of the school disco because he thinks it will spoil his rap image. He gets Mr Janucek to take over but he hasn't realised that Miss Poppy will be there. Josh asks Zoe Marie to go to the disco with him by mistake but how can he now wriggle out of the date? Meanwhile Ash seems to be asking almost every girl in the school to go there with him.

5.title: Laptop
5.plot: Nathan borrows one of the school laptops without telling the school but when Josh is later found with it he is accused of theft and Mr Byron orders a crackdown which annoys the students. This might prevent Ash from drawing the life model in an after-school art class he has been looking forward to.

6.title: Party
6.plot: Nathan and Josh both have plans while their mother is on holiday. Nathan arranges a meeting with Miss Poppy but a misleading story by Josh puts him in an awkward position. Josh organises a small party but finds that things getting out of hand.

7.title: Football
7.plot: Josh sees joining the school football team as a way of getting out of other lessons and Ash and Ryan join him. However football training may not be the easy option he thinks it is. Ryan is worried about getting a key assessment done and Molly offers to help but has he made the right decision?

8.title: Quiz
8.plot: Josh surprisingly scores top grades on his work so is recruited onto the school quiz team along with Molly and Ryan but is he really the top student he now appears to be? Ryan cannot understand why Molly is being so nice to him while strange things are turning up in Ash's locker.

9.title: Auction
9.plot: Josh enjoys music lessons but is frustrated at the disintegrating equipment so suggests to Miss Poppy that the staff and students auction things to get money to buy replacements. She suggests that the staff auction their services and that Nathan act as a butler for the day. Nathan becomes particularly worried when Zoe-Marie shows an interest in buying his services - humiliation seems to be on the cards.

10.title: School Council
10.plot: Mr Byron gets a reluctant Nathan to chair the school council and he recruits an even more reluctant Josh to take part. Against the wishes of council member Natalie, Josh gets a trip organised to see a DJ instead of going to the Town Hall but this is a problem for Nathan as he has invited Miss Poppy out on the same day. What is he to do?

11.title: Sweets
11.plot: Molly, Ryan and Ash try to make money by running a tuck shop against school rules but have to keep a sharp look-out for Mr Byron who is trying to promote healthy eating. Miss Poppy asks the students to write songs about relationships. She asks Nathan to help Zoe-Marie write her song as she is short on confidence but helping such an over-sensitive student isn't easy while Josh feels his brother is ignoring his own efforts.

12.title: Fight
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: End of Term
13.plot: Mr. Byron is about to review Nathan's progress as a teacher. Nathan is worried and gets the impression that he has no future at the school and should move on, perhaps working with his friend and successful rapper B-Mode. However does Nathan really understand how the students feel about him?

1.title: New Term
1.plot: Mr. Bell arrives as the new Head of Elmsbury. He has plans to shake up the school which is now to become "Elmsbury Academy". He organises a re-naming ceremony but Josh Carter has his own ideas on how to mark the occasion.

2.title: Head of Year
2.plot: Nathan competes against PE teacher Mr Thorne to become the new Head of Year. Meanwhile Dexter Harris has arrived to assist Miss Poppy in the Music Department but is he really cut out for the world of teaching?

3.title: Dexter's Big Week
3.plot: Nathan is about to leave on a teacher exchange but how will the students react? Mr Bell urges Dexter to get tough to prove he has a future at Elmsbury but his attempts at discipline don't have the desired effect.

4.title: Ice Cream
4.plot: Mr Bell bans the students from visiting an ice cream van outside the school but that doesn't stop Tom and Zoe-Marie from getting carried away when they sneak out. Dexter tries to get tough with the students including Agness who is not doing her homework but has he misjudged her? Mr Bell has an offer for Miss Poppy that leaves her in an awkward position.

5.title: Dexter's Dad
5.plot: Dexter is put in an embarrassing situation when his dad turns up at the school for a head-teachers' conference - will he discover that Dexter isn't actually an "assistant head-teacher" to Mr Bell? Dexter has also asked the members of the 4 O'Clock Club to look after "flour babies" to teach them responsibility but can they be trusted?

6.title: Points
6.plot: Mr Bell introduces a new system of rewarding good behaviour with points which can lead to prizes including a computer. Josh soon works out how to take advantage of the system while Mr Bell's idea to encourage the teachers to give out the most points leads to its own problems.

7.title: Valentine's Day
7.plot: Josh gets a Valentine's card for Rachel but will his friends and his own embarrassment at his musical link-up with cousin Dexter stop him getting to go out with her? Ryan receives a surprise romantic message and unusual gift in his cello case but who has sent it?

8.title: School Trip
8.plot: Dexter takes the students out on a half-term field trip to the countryside but it is clear they are not used to a more basic lifestyle. He also has to cope with Mr Thorne who has his PE students on the trip and his own ideas on how things should be done. Mr Bell takes the opportunity of a student-free school to try to impress its new sponsors.

9.title: Suspension
9.plot: After "achieving" his tenth detention of the term Mr Bell has had enough of Josh and suspends him - unfortunately for him on the very day when a record company representative is due to visit the school as part of its careers day. Aside from Josh the students are less than enthusiastic about the careers day but Dexter appears to have secured the presence of a top employer.

10.title: Rights and Responsibilites
10.plot: Mr Bell promotes the importance of "rights and responsibilities" to improve school life but the students feel their rights are being ignored and it's all about their responsibilities.

11.title: Music Thief
11.plot: Josh is excited after recording a new track and gets his friends to help him sell it on CDs he's taken from the school. However it's soon discovered he's used the bass-line from another track without permission and they have to get the CDs back before they get into trouble. Meanwhile Dexter is trying to impress WPC Rowe by teaching her the ukulele - but first he has to learn to play it himself.

12.title: Lockdown
12.plot: Dexter confiscates the mobile phones of students in detention and in retaliation Josh locks him out of the room when he goes out for a moment. While the pair of them try to sort things out a number of incidents involving the members of the 4 O'Clock Club are remembered.

13.title: Project Zenith
13.plot: Mr Bell asks Dexter to present his plans for "Project Zenith" to renovate the school. What he doesn't tell Dexter is that it will involve demolishing the building holding the 4 O'Clock Club, putting luxury apartments in its place, and sending its members to Fowlmere, the worst school in the area. How can Dexter save his reputation and the members of the 4 O'Clock Club?

1.title: Christmas
1.plot: Miss Andress and Mr Bell decide to "cancel Christmas" at the school because they say it isn't fair to favour one type of celebration over another. However the students decide to take matters into their own hands. Meanwhile Agness and her family return home to a shocking discovery and Nathan has something to ask Miss Poppy.

2.title: Wedding
2.plot: It is the day of Nathan and Miss Poppy's wedding. However Elmsbury students get involved in the events and the preparations don't go all to plan. Josh's cousin Nero comes along but he seems to have other things on his mind. The evening celebrations close in a dramatic way that no-one could have expected.

3.title: Merger
3.plot: Elmsbury and Fowlmere have to merge following the fire but students and staff from the different schools don't find it easy to get on. Ryan and Molly head off to a private school where they are unpleasantly surprised to find one of their former teachers. Dexter's attempts to teach first aid lead to an alarming rumour about what he has in the boot of his car.

4.title: Cross Country
4.plot: Mr Bell announces that after the merger the school will now be called "Elmsmere". He unveils a new statue to mark the change but it leaves the pupils highly unimpressed and it is clear he and Mrs O'Brien are not entering into the spirit of partnership. The statue does give some of the students ideas on how to get ahead and their devious ideas also extend to the cross-country competition.

5.title: Bench
5.plot: Mr Bell is annoyed when he discovers a bench dedicated to Mrs O'Brien. Nero finds an scrapbook belonging to Josh and takes it to school but makes a surprising and valuable discovery when he opens it.

6.title: Choir
6.plot: When Dexter starts a choir, Josh thinks it is the lamest thing in the world - until Rachel joins and Josh decides it is the perfect way to get close to her.

7.title: Mugs
7.plot: Josh decides to skip school to attend a music workshop but is shocked to find someone else who shouldn't be there. Dexter gets involved in a petty argument with Bebe over biscuits but her attempt to teach him a lesson leads to some unexpected consequences.

12.title: Prefects
12.plot: Mr Bell makes some very peculiar choices for prefects - but why?

13.title: Audition
13.plot: Josh auditions for a performing arts school but his friends don't want him to leave. Mr Bell and Mrs O'Brien fight it out to be the new head and have to impress not only the governors but a panel of students.

1.title: Ghost
1.plot: A new girl comes to school, who behaves realy badly, and joins Niro and his friend to sneak into school to find a ghost.

2.title: Toads
2.plot: When Nero accidently lets the school toads escape, he sets off a chain of events that gets Dexter into serious trouble. Is this the end for the 4 o'clock club?

3.title: Theatre
3.plot: Clem and Nero are both suspiciously keen to go on a school trip to the theatre.

4.title: Bike
4.plot: Nero's new bike proves to be a disaster, not just for him but Clem and Dexter too. Someone will have to pay.

13.plot: When the school show looks like being cancelled, Nero gets angry and runs away from home. Clem is forced to go with him and they are confronted by some very awkward truths.

1.title: Antenatal
1.plot: It's a new term at Elmsmere and Nero and Clem are finally a couple. Meantime, Dexter and Lizzie are expecting a baby. Mr Nunn isn't happy when he has to cover for their lessons while they go to an antenatal class. Amber,Darnesh and Violet try to convince Mr Nunn that you can stick a person to the ceiling via static electricity. And at the antenatal Lizzie and Dexter meet Ash and Zoe-Marie. Clem, Eleesha, Fleur and Owen's girlfriend Katie go to a poetry convention, but they get bored and goes to Nero's party. Clem thinks it's better if she and Nero just stay friends so...

2.title: Pass
2.plot: Clem has an advert to film and so she lies to Mr Bell about having a dentist appointment to get absence pass. However, when Nero find out about the advert he wants in on it to. Meanwhile, Owen has a new gate duty job to report all the late students.But he is unhappy when Katie joins him on the job and he admits to Eli that she's becoming too much for him. Nero and Clem clearly still have feelings for each other but are scared to admit it to each other. Amber steals a whole bunch of authorization passes to allow students to leave. Nero takes over Owen's job and allows ...

3.title: Karaoke
3.plot: Clem has the chance to blow up her music career - in which case she'd have to leave Elmsmere. Amber tries to convince Ingrid that she has an astronaut uncle, and Mr Nunn has trouble forming a football team.

4.title: Baby
4.plot: A special musical episode. Amber doesn't want to know where babies come from - especially from her sister. She might have to when Lizzie starts having labour pains, with Dexter nowhere to be seen. Nero runs away from home.

5.title: Volcano
5.plot: Nero's science project partner doesn't tolerate his attitude. Amber and co. accidentally trash the school library, and Mr Bell tries to hide the fact he lives in a caravan.

6.title: Rash
6.plot: Dexter faces a dilemma when he has to register the twins' names but mixes them up. Nero develops a strange rash. Amber tries to hand-make a gift for the twins.

7.title: Chair
7.plot: Everyone's surprised to see that Mr Bell has a son. Meanwhile, Nero risks trouble to help Polly, Eli is lead to believe he has special powers, and Mr Nunn tries to one-up Dexter's arts festival trip.

8.title: Gig
8.plot: Polly thinks Nero's finally done something right after he gets tickets to see her favourite band. Darnesh ends up on a literally blind date, and Mr Bell and Mr Nunn go to a single parent group meeting.

9.title: Funeral
9.plot: Owen skives off school to avoid Sports Day, but has issues meeting Mr Nunn's strict deal about his excuse. Mrs Goodman is lead to believe Amber needs therapy after she pretends to eat a fish.

10.title: Flashmob
10.plot: Nero tries to micromanage dancing with both Katie and Polly, whilst CJ tries to find a way out of the caravan to get to a flashmob when he's stuck with Mr Bell.

11.title: Paperboy
11.plot: Amber's joyride on Isaac's new ride-on floor cleaner ends up in Isaac potentially losing his job. Nero, Dexter and Chester get stuck in Mrs Goodman's house on a paper round, and Fleur and Eleesha try to shake off a desperate Eli.

12.title: Camping
12.plot: Nero and the boys' camping trip coincides with CJ and Mr Bell's, as well as Mr Nunn's. Meanwhile, Amber attempts to cut Darnesh's hair to save £10. Lizzie gets locked in her car, to the dismay of Isaac, who has to face the consequences.

13.title: Ring
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Boxes
1.plot: Elsmere has moved to a new building. Everybody is stressing out, especially Mrs Goodman. Darnesh, Cj, Amber, Ingrid and Violet decide to play with the removal boxes. But it does'nt turn out to be such a good idea. Meanwhile Polly has a radio solo, but Nero with a hope of being famous jumps in. First it's going great, but everything turns to a disaster.

2.title: Film
2.plot: Nero encourages Mrs Goodman to make a lip dub video to celebrate Elmsmere, Polly tries to retake a test to get full marks, and Darnesh loses a glasses lens to Amber's newly discovered peephole into the staff-room.

3.title: America
3.plot: Dexter, Lizzie and Nero are leaving Elmsmere for good - but Dexter has second thoughts after meeting the teacher that will be stepping into his shoes. Amber, CJ and friends try to interview the new music teacher.

4.title: Farewell
4.plot: Dexter, Lizzie and Nero are leaving Elmsmere for good - but Dexter has second thoughts after meeting the teacher that will be stepping into his shoes. Amber, CJ and friends try to interview the new music teacher.

5.title: Mr Garland
5.plot: Mr Boyd mistakes Owen for a teacher due to the latter wearing his grandfather's coat, causing confusion when Owen's party coincides with the teacher's party. Amber and Violet try to finally put a stop to Darnesh's Big Birthday Fun List.

6.title: Prank
6.plot: A phantom prankster makes Polly reconsider her role in her friendship group. Mr Bell tries to win over Miss Harper but regrets doing so, and Amber's plan to ruin everyone's perfect attendance to win a scooter backfires.

7.title: Tattoo
7.plot: Amber tries to form a band to beat Ingrid in a battle of the bands contest. Polly risks getting into trouble when she can't get rid of a face tattoo, and Mr Bell finds Miss Harper a new home - in his flat.

8.title: Museum
8.plot: Mr Bell loses Miss Harper's son on a school trip to the museum, whilst Amber uses Darnesh to convince Ingrid the museum holds a cursed mummy. Polly tries to avoid punishment from her mum by setting up a fake art gallery.

9.title: Space
9.plot: Owen faces a dilemma when he tries to earn a Scouts badge using a dummy. Meanwhile, Polly, Eleesha and Fleur have to chase a weather balloon, and Isaac must learn maths from Mr Nunn.

10.title: Rats
10.plot: Mr Bell's magic performance is put at risk after Isaac causes a series of catastrophic events by trying to catch a rat with Darnesh's cat. Polly's plan to help Owen move on from Katie backfires.

11.title: Holiday
11.plot: CJ has trouble convincing Mr Bell to go on a family holiday he's won, Amber challenges Ingrid on a mobile game, and Owen is forced to be the prize to a rigged raffle when Eli blows the budget on t-shirts.

12.title: Nanna Murphy
12.plot: Darnesh's questions his newfound modelling career when he's told he's going to have to model nude. Eleesha and Fleur lie to Polly to get out of a trip, and Owen is left feeling lovesick yet again.

imdb.title: 4 O'Clock Club

other companies.name: EuroKids & Adults International Casting and Model Agency
Victor Humphries t/a Vision Motor Services

plot: Two brothers go to the same school. One is a teacher and the other is a pupil.
synopsis: Josh Carter runs things. At 13 years old, he is master of all he surveys - particularly his school, the run-down Elmsbury High. His art of manipulating everyone and everything on school grounds is second only to his desire to become a rap superstar.But Josh's perfect world is about to come crumbling down. Ten years ago, another Carter named Nathan walked out of Elmsbury High in disgrace having spent his entire time as a pupil creating mischief of the highest order. Funnily enough, his art of manipulating everyone and everything on school grounds was second only to his desire to become a rap superstar. Now he's washed up. He's hit rock bottom. In fact - lower than rock bottom: he's training to be a teacher.His first placement: Elmsbury High, where the same Head remembers him with disgust, the custard is still served by the slice and a 13 year old boy is about to embark on an all out war with his own brother.
